channel.title: Resources on I, Oliver Bonham-Carter, In June
channel.description: Recent content in Resources on I, Oliver Bonham-Carter, In June

item.title: Women In Computing
item.description: ​ ​ Opportunities for Women in Computing Below are some links from National Center for Women & Information Technology (NCWIT) which offers women support, encouragement and information to help women to gain experience in computing and to build meaningful careers in computing technology. The National Center for Women & Information Technology (NCWIT) is the farthest-reaching network of change leaders focused on advancing innovation by correcting underrepresentation in computing. NCWIT

item.title: Setting up Netlify
item.description: These steps assume that you have already built a website with Hugo, and have installed a theme. Netlify Go to Netlify’s website and sign up or log in. Go to the “Sites” tab and click on “Add new site” Select “Import an existing project” Connect to GitHub by clicking on the “GitHub” button Choose the repository to link to your site on Netlify. Verify the settings. Deploy the site by clicking on the “Deploy site” button.

item.title: Build a Hugo Site with a Theme
item.description: Making a website with Hugo: You might want to use this bare-bones website template for an online research website. Below is code to create a website and then to add posts (blogs) to the project. Each of these posts that you create could be akin to pages in a book that you could organize chronologically. Have fun! ​ ​ ​ ​ Setting Up You will need to first install HUGO to build and test your website locally.

item.title: Junior Seminar Resources
item.description: Welcome to a resources page for Junior Seminar research. Here you will find a list of links for data, tools, tutorials and related resources that may be very helpful to your work. Software RStudio R Programming Language Python Programming Language Git for Mac Git for Windows Git for all platforms Online Tools sentiment viz Tweet Sentiment Visualization Online R programming Snippets – Run any R code you line online JDoodle Tutorials

item.title: Data Science Resources
item.description: Welcome to a resources page for Data Science research. Here you will find a list of links for data, tools, tutorials and related resources that may be very helpful to your work. ​ Textbooks Wickham, Hadley, and Garrett Grolemund. R for Data Science: Import, Tidy, Transform, Visualize, and Model Data., O’Reilly Media, Inc., 2016. Book Website Latest version of the book Julia Silge And David Robinson. Text Mining With R: A Tidy Approach.

item.title: BioMedical and Bioinformatics Resources
item.description: Welcome to a resources page for Bioinformatics research. Here you will find a list of links for data, tools, tutorials and related resources that may be very helpful to your work. Software Installations RStudio R Programming Language Python Programming Language Git for Mac Git for Windows Git for all platforms Python Programming Language Python for Biologists BioPython Online Tools sentiment viz Tweet Sentiment Visualization Online R programming Snippets – Run any R code you line online JDoodle Python Programming Resources

item.title: Writing Resources
item.description: The Steps of Writing an Introduction Writing a thesis introduction is a crucial part of your overall thesis work. It sets the stage for your research and provides the reader with an overview of the key elements of your study. Here are the basic steps to help you write a compelling thesis introduction: Start with a Hook: Begin your introduction with a compelling hook or an engaging anecdote that captures the reader’s attention.

item.title: Jupyterlite
item.description: Python in the Cloud?! Yes! Have something like a simple algorithm or a back-of-the-envolop experiment that you want to try out right this momement?! No need to waste time to setup your Python3 interpretor on your machine! Besides, __you could forget all the variables and, or the parts of your experiment! Go online with it! Play with Python in a convenient online browser. Remember, to save all your important work to your own notes and files on your machine since you cannot save your work online for great lengths of time.
